Publication Title: Microglia promote anti-tumour immunity and suppress breast cancer brain metastasis
Publication Authors: Katrina T Evans, Kerrigan Blake, Aaron Longworth, Morgan A Coburn, Jacob Insua-Rodr√≠guez, Timothy P McMullen, Quy H Nguyen, Dennis Ma, Tatyana Lev, Grace A Hernandez, Armani K Oganyan, Davit Orujyan, Robert A Edwards, Clare Pridans, Kim N Green, S Armando Villalta, Mathew Blurton-Jones, Devon A Lawson
Publication Abstract: Breast cancer brain metastasis (BCBM) is a lethal disease with no effective treatments. Prior work has shown that brain cancers and metastases are densely infiltrated with anti-inflammatory, protumourigenic tumour-associated macrophages, but the role of brain-resident microglia remains controversial because they are challenging to discriminate from other tumour-associated macrophages.
